column4: hey, where can I get help getting to understand Ubuntu better? This channel or somewhere else?
Is there something in particular you wish to know/

I have a few specific questions, yes. Yesterday I did 'sudo apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop', updated and upgraded, then 'sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop' - but I don't see any difference, how can I check?
Log out. Then at the bottom of the screen, choose your desktop environment manually.
I've literally just done the same. Trying out xfce
Did you run sudo apt-get update ?
Then remove the repo.
ubuntu is Debian based. And releases much more often. However when Debian does release, it's a little more stable.
yes.
Glad you could boot properly.
do you know what that error message means? Why I can't access my home dir?
Not too sure on that one, I haven't had chance to learn the Linux file system well enough yet. sorry.
Right click on the desktop.
have you tried it with root privelages/
'Better' is subjective. It's all opinion based.
how can you get duplicates on a Debian foundation? O.o
that's probably because you need to fix some confs, once you get XFCE up and running I'm sure you'll like it =)
I've removed it. Currently removing all the extras it installed and didn't remove when i uninstalled it.
I'd remove ubuntu-desktop and then install xubuntu-desktop, but I'm not too sure if that's enough
I'm aiming to revert to how it was before. ie gnome2.
you chicken out already? ;)
Pretty much. I need my environment to look somewhat pretty, something that Gnome allwos me.
aim for Gnome3/xfce then
